posts.title: Building Hybrid AI Systems: Combining Neural and Symbolic Approaches
posts.excerpt: Exploring how to merge deep learning with symbolic reasoning for more robust and interpretable AI systems.
posts.content: In this post, I discuss my experience building HybEx-Law, a hybrid system that combines LegalBERT embeddings with Graph Neural Networks and Prolog-based symbolic reasoning. The key insight is that neural models excel at pattern recognition while symbolic systems provide interpretability and rule-based guarantees...
posts.author: Mohit Kumar

posts.title: Multi-Agent Research Automation with LangGraph
posts.excerpt: How I built Nexus, a three-agent system that automates research discovery and synthesis using LangGraph orchestration.
posts.content: Nexus demonstrates the power of multi-agent architectures for complex workflows. By splitting responsibilities across specialized agents—Research Agent for data collection, Reporting Agent for synthesis, and Storage Agent for output—we achieve 75% reduction in manual effort...
posts.author: Mohit Kumar

posts.title: Layout-Free Parking Detection with Swin Transformers
posts.excerpt: Achieving 98.99% mAP50 in parking slot detection without predefined layouts using augmented Swin Transformer backbone.
posts.content: Traditional parking detection systems rely on predefined layouts, limiting their flexibility. In this project, I augmented the Swin Transformer with GLCM texture features via FiLM fusion, enabling dynamic slot inference in bird's-eye view space...
posts.author: Mohit Kumar
